reviewText:
Disappointing.
When you get in game, the title says Crazy Squirrel, not Rapid Squirrel.
The controls and camera angle are awkward.
Very limited amount of choices for customizing your squirrel.
Looks like Scrat from Ice Age.

I like the concept, but that's probably a tad bit biased coming from someone who calls themselves the Flying Squirrel.
voteText: 40 of 48 people (83%) found this review helpful 11 people found this review funny

reviewText:
I normally don't write my reviews in english but now I feel I have to warn as many people as possible even with my bad english. ;)

This game is a really really poor handy- or tablet port.
First of all the tutorial shows you how to fly with your squirrel on a touchpad-device...there is nothing to look the PC-Controlls up...you have to find it out by yourself and even if you understand the controlls after a while they are so clunky and unfinished.
Every time the game says to you I am a bad poooort"! There are even two important "skills" without any button...yeah you have to klick it manuell with your mouse in the right lower corner...the same mouse that leads the flying-direction by the way. So you will end up flying into the right corner every time you need to look the goal-island up and fly out of the map.

Tha camera is made by someone who hasn't played the game I think.
The cam points diagonal from the right side onto the squirrel...that means you always fly to the right side out of the map.
Constantly you have to change direction to not fall out of the map.
FALL is a good point too....sometimes I fly sometimes I fall and it seems pretty random even if I am 16m/s fast I keep falling.

I don't want to tell you about every bug now but in only 20min I found nearly 4 of them and all appeared not only once.
For example "glitch into an island and don't stand up again".

I think they just want to make more money with this game but without any effort. So they put the accect same portable version onto the pc.
Don't spend your money and your time on this one...it feels unfinished like in an alpha.
I don't think it plays better on the acctual devices for what it is made."
voteText: 19 of 22 people (86%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
Product received for free

This is the second title I've played by  Rai Studio Games.  It is just as simplistic, shoddy, and worthless as Base Squad 49.  It just looks a little better.  I have not yet played their second Steam title, Land of Devastation, and will not do so unless I get a free key, as I did with this one and BS49.  The only penny I'll ever give to this sorry excuse for a developer" is the penny they'll get when I sell one of their trading cards.  And that's more than this game is worth.
Seven levels
date: all of which involve doing what you see in the video on the Store page
recommended: and nothing else.\nThe tutorial level (which is one of the seven)
hoursPlayed: only has instructions for tablet controls.\nThe mouse/keyboard controls—once you figure them out yourself—are good
voteText: if you like clicking the bottom corner of the screen over and over.\nCannot remap controls.\nNo options screen at all except to change your squirrel's color (three choices: spotted tail
votesHelpful:
all of them with the same-colored squirrel).
Music is annoying synthesized loops that gets tiresome almost as soon as you start listening to it.
No save/load system.  There would be no point.  There's nothing you'd want to save.
Trading cards still don't work
votesTotal: nearly three weeks after the game's launch.\nAchievements are simplistic and meaningless.  All of them involve merely completing levels and tasks x number of times.\nAɴᴅ Mᴏsᴛ Iᴍᴘᴏʀᴛᴀɴᴛʟʏ: loaded with fake positive reviews from the get-go
votesFunny: just like Base Squad 49.  Ignore them.  They are bogus.  No one could possibly enjoy playing this game.  I did play it.  And it did suck.0/10"
